comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In 1914, Heydler was President of Baseball's National League. He returned to the league headquarters in New York City in January, after attending the joint schedule meeting in French Lick Springs, Indiana, and a recent conference with the Players' Fraternity at Cincinnati. In a New York Times story, Heydler spelled out some of the decisions that had been made at the two meetings. New York Times, January 11, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9A0DE0DF1E39E6...
